Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of Aphrodite tying a fillet around her head, or wearing a diadem. Mould-made and hollow. White (gypsum) coating traces. Red-brown Nile silt fabric with abundant fine gold mica, quartz, organics and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Poor parallels of Aphrodite figures in this pose are dated from the 2nd or 1st century BC (Bailey 2008, no.3352), 1st-2nd century AD (ibid., no.3349) and 2nd-3rd century AD (Török 1995, no.3) and undated (Fischer 1994, no.63 of ‘Early Classical’ style). Fischer, J. 1994. Griechisch-römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber. Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen. Tübingen, Wasmuth. Török, L. 1995. Hellenistic and Roman terracottas from Egypt. Roma.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.222) (Phase 1)
